posts.name: Caleb Piña
posts.cooked: Does anybody knows what is a good way or app to make a good electrical diagram?

posts.name: freddie s
posts.cooked: As much as I hate it… KiCAD is pretty good for electrical wiring diagrams! Unfortunately, is it neither cloud based nor is it collaborative, so all the work has to be done one person at a time. I’ve heard of other people using things like Figma, Canva, and even Google Slides! Good luck!

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: blue loctite does NOT taste good

posts.custom_user_title: blue loctite does NOT taste good

posts.name: Caleb Piña
posts.cooked: Thank you, i am doing it alone anyways so no problem

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked:
I would suggest getting a free (sponsored) copy of AutoCAD 2D. It is the industry standard drawing package for making wiring drawings and is better suited to drawing wiring diagrams than generic drawing programs. I was just using it for exactly this purpose earlier this morning. I believe that FRC teams can also get a free copy of AutoCAD Electrical but many of the extra features are really only useful for those doing mass manufacturing.

Years ago, I tried to use KiCAD to make an electrical drawing for FRC robots because I wanted to exploit the “rubberbanding” feature found in KiCAD (and Altium). Unfortunately, I found that the time required to make the symbols for all the components and other setup tasks required made it very time consuming and impractical. Modifying the symbols to fit the application was also cumbersome. All programs like KiCAD and Altium that are meant for electronic circuit board (PCB) design will have the same advantages and disadvantages.

I just found a cloud-based electrical CAD program, Capital X. They appear to offer licenses for students and educators (see FAQ section of second link).

Capital X Panel Designer electrical design SaaS offering gives individual designers or small teams an affordable yet powerful electrical design solution.

Cloud-native Capital X Panel Designer SaaS offering gives individual designers or small teams an affordable yet powerful electrical design solution.

posts.name: Caleb Piña
posts.cooked: will definetly check it out, thanks

posts.name: Raymond
posts.cooked: Darw.io is a really nice web app for it, connects to Google drive and is collabritive.
draw.io looks great. You can also get a bit fancier and use the images prepared by the team who does the unofficial posters 2025 Unofficial FRC Control System Diagrams
We’ve used excalidraw to make diagrams like this before.

link_counts.title: Excalidraw | Hand-drawn look & feel • Collaborative • Secure

posts.name: Taiki Rogers
posts.cooked: It is very annoying but if you are doing it with other people I have used google drawings to make it. This is ours for the 2025 season

+1 for AutoCAD 2D. That’s what we use at work for our electrical drawings. We use autocad electrical but that is mostly for the standard symbols and other stuff that robotics teams wouldn’t need. Have done drawings in normal autoCAD for school before.
